result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court for Markell Sinclair Hughes.  Attorney Grace M. Gall appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests an additional status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court for Markell Sinclair Hughes.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date. Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  24 hour curfew with release for verified work or school only.  No alternative.  All other previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes in court with Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.

Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes in court with Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney.  State moves to have the matter set in the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:

Lamar J W.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Markell Sinclair Hughes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
